installedSkills.name: atlassian
installedSkills.description: Interact with Atlassian Jira and Confluence from the terminal. Search, create, and update Jira tickets; read, search, create, and update Confluence pages. Use when the user mentions Jira tickets, issues, work items, sprints, Confluence pages, documentation, or Atlassian in general.

installedSkills.name: bdd
installedSkills.description: Documentation-first, test-driven development workflow for building applications. Use when starting new features, implementing functionality, or following structured development processes. Guides through phases - vision, architecture, data modeling, integration tests, unit tests, and implementation.

installedSkills.name: developing-tickets
installedSkills.description: Use when the user says "develop PP-XYZ" or asks to work on, develop, or implement a ticket, issue, or story referenced by ID

installedSkills.name: estimation
installedSkills.description: Estimate the effort of user stories, tasks, bugs, or raw requirements using story points. Use when the user asks to estimate, size, or score a ticket, story, feature, or piece of work.

installedSkills.name: google-drive
installedSkills.description: Operate Google services from the terminal using gog. Use when requests involve Gmail, Calendar, Chat, Classroom, Drive, Docs, Slides, Contacts, Tasks, People, Sheets, Forms, Apps Script, Groups, or Keep workflows, including auth checks, data listing/search, file transfer, and command automation.

installedSkills.name: test-driven-development
installedSkills.description: Use when implementing any feature or bugfix, before writing implementation code

installedSkills.name: thank-you-next
installedSkills.description: Use when the user wants prompt-only backlog progression: select the next not_started story from docs/backlog.yaml, mark it in_progress, write a plan, and implement it.

installedSkills.name: user-story
installedSkills.description: Transform requirements into structured user stories with acceptance criteria using INVEST principles. Use when the user asks to write a user story, create a ticket, define acceptance criteria, or convert requirements into dev-ready stories.

installedSkills.name: using-superpowers
installedSkills.description: Use when starting any conversation - establishes how to find and use skills, requiring Skill tool invocation before ANY response including clarifying questions

installedSkills.name: workflow
installedSkills.description: Orchestrate complex tasks with planning, subagents, and verification. Use when starting multi-step tasks, managing todo items, coordinating work with subagents, or when the user mentions planning, verification, or task management.

installedSkills.name: writing-plans
installedSkills.description: Use when you have a spec or requirements for a multi-step task, before touching code

installedSkills.name: writing-skills
installedSkills.description: Use when creating new skills, editing existing skills, or verifying skills work before deployment
